channel.title: guideline on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in guideline on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Memo Knowledge Base Meeting
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Memo knowledge base meeting Memo is our team’s wiki on how we work, learn, operate the team at Dwarves. It’s a one-stop shop for all things Dwarves, written by us for fellow craftsmen.

item.title: Memo Publication Workflow
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Choosing the right directory for the right topic The first thing is to determine the field that you’re writing in.

item.title: How to make a MOC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This memo explains how to create a Map of Content (MOC) for our knowledge hubs. The concept was introduced by Nick Milo, who also runs courses on Linking Your Thinking.

item.title: How I Create Content for Multiple Platforms at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Road to Discover Dwarves’ Voice: As you know, each individual at Dwarves represents craftsmanship and well-crafted products. I consider craftsmanship as one of the most fundamental aspects of our work, reflected in every piece of content we create.

item.title: Writing Content for Multimedia Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: “ It’s not that we need a unified language in all contexts; rather we just need enough context to get everyone on the same page.

item.title: Design less, present more with Deckset
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Do you ever feel overwhelmed by the myriad of design tools and options in PowerPoint, or the countless books and tutorials dedicated to beautifying a single sentence on a 100-inch screen?

item.title: Level Up Your Markdown Memos: Avoiding Common Pitfalls
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Markdown uses symbols and stuff to make your text look fancy. It’s like learning a new skill, game, or design program - there will be bumps in the road before you’re a pro.

item.title: How to set up environment to edit memo
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Set up SSH key SSH key is a secure authentication method which includes a public key and a private key.

item.title: How To Take Better Screenshots On Mac
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I grab screenshots pretty often. Although macOS’s native screenshot tool is decent for most cases, it’s still a very basic one.

item.title: How to push content on memo.d.foundation
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before edit or create a new post Before you can create a new post, please make sure that you have finished setting up the environment for editting memo in this post, and you have the right access and edit the repository memo.

item.title: Estimation Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When we conduct an estimation, it is recommended to abandon the transitional “exact hours” assessment method, instead, use the story point based on the Fibonacci number (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21…).

item.title: aarrr
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: AARRR framework We use the AARRR framework to measure and optimize every phase of a product by optimizing it through the insane focus on one metric at a time.

item.title: Design Sprint
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is the design sprint? The sprint is a four-day process for answering critical business questions through design, prototyping and testing ideas with customers.

item.title: FBSC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Budget We do need to know clients’ budgets. This is often uncomfortable for them but their budget helps determines what scope is possible.

item.title: Low-fidelity prototype: UI Design
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Research 1. Understand prospect Understanding stakeholder, company, business model, goals and challenges of the product in order to set mindset, define style, color palette, and typography, iconography, illustration, and photography.
